definition: Confucius and Mencius
hole/CL:個|个[ge4]/classifier for cave dwellings
surname Kong
surname Meng
first month of a season/eldest amongst brothers
the teaching of Confucius and Mencius

sentences.english: This was the fundamental reason why the doctrine of Confucius and Mencius had become the ruling thoughts of autocratic monarchy in Imperial China.
sentences.chinese: 这是孔孟之道成为中华帝制统治思想的根本原因。

sentences.english: Can make the Confucianism thoroughfare thought reserve and promote.
sentences.chinese: 使儒家孔孟思想得以保留并且发扬光大。

sentences.english: He quoted profusely from Confucius and Mencius in his essays.
sentences.chinese: 他在文章中摘引孔孟的言论很多。

sentences.english: After all, is not the doctrine of Confucius and Mencius oasis.
sentences.chinese: 毕竟是片没有孔孟之道的绿洲。

sentences.english: Kong_Meng's ideology of humanity and filial piety represents the ancient humanitarianism.
sentences.chinese: 孔孟的仁孝观体现了古代人道主义。

definition: the teaching of Confucius and Mencius
Confucian school, founded by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC) and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] (c. 372-c. 289 BC)
Confucianism
Confucian thoughts/the thinking of the Confucian school
a sage/wise and holy man/virtuous ruler/Buddhist lama/wine
Mencius (c. 372-c. 289 BC), Confucian philosopher second only to Confucius/book of the same name, one of the classics of Confucianism
Confucianism
Confucius (551-479 BC), Chinese thinker and social philosopher, also known as 孔夫子[Kong3 fu1 zi3]
Confucius
the Sage Confucius
Confucian
Confucius' school (i.e. his direct disciples)
Master Zhu, another name for Zhu Xi 朱熹
Dong Zhongshu (179-104 BC), philosopher influential in establishing Confucianism as the established system of values of former Han dynasty
Xun Zi or Hsun Tzu (c. 310-237 BC), Confucian philosopher and author of On learning 勸學|劝学
The Analects of Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3]
